fsaintjacques commented on pull request #5868: ARROW-7161: [C++] Migrate filesystem APIs from Status to Result
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5868#discussion_r348285334
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/common.h
 ##########
 @@ -64,12 +64,12 @@ inline Status CheckPyError(StatusCode code = StatusCode::UnknownError) {
 // This function can set a Python exception.  It assumes that T has a (cheap)
 // default constructor.
 template <class T>
-T GetResultValue(Result<T>& result) {
+T GetResultValue(Result<T> result) {
 
 Review comment:
   Do you want a rvalue instead? If this is a C++/Python bridge limitation, please document via comment. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5868#discussion_r348516812
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/common.h
 ##########
 @@ -64,12 +64,12 @@ inline Status CheckPyError(StatusCode code = StatusCode::UnknownError) {
 // This function can set a Python exception.  It assumes that T has a (cheap)
 // default constructor.
 template <class T>
-T GetResultValue(Result<T>& result) {
+T GetResultValue(Result<T> result) {
 
 Review comment:
   I meant universal reference instead of rvalue reference. Right now it always copy. This might get tricky to implement due to the requirement of returning even in the case of a failure, @bkietz.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #5868: ARROW-7161: [C++] Migrate filesystem APIs from Status to Result
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5868#discussion_r348543038
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/common.h
 ##########
 @@ -64,12 +64,12 @@ inline Status CheckPyError(StatusCode code = StatusCode::UnknownError) {
 // This function can set a Python exception.  It assumes that T has a (cheap)
 // default constructor.
 template <class T>
-T GetResultValue(Result<T>& result) {
+T GetResultValue(Result<T> result) {
 
 Review comment:
   The difference it brings is that it can support lvalue without expliciting the move, which otherwise induce a copy if the value is copyable. This might not be worth the effort.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on pull request #5868: ARROW-7161: [C++] Migrate filesystem APIs from Status to Result
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5868#discussion_r349005296
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/common.h
 ##########
 @@ -64,12 +64,12 @@ inline Status CheckPyError(StatusCode code = StatusCode::UnknownError) {
 // This function can set a Python exception.  It assumes that T has a (cheap)
 // default constructor.
 template <class T>
-T GetResultValue(Result<T>& result) {
+T GetResultValue(Result<T> result) {
 
 Review comment:
   @fsaintjacques That would be true if `Result` was a template parameter, but it's a concrete class here. `Result<T>&&` simply wouldn't match a lvalue, AFAIU.
   
   See https://isocpp.org/blog/2012/11/universal-references-in-c11-scott-meyers and in particular the example:
   ```c++
   template<typename T>
   void f(std::vector<T>&& param);  // here, “&&” means rvalue reference
    
   template<typename T>
   void f(T&& param);               // here, “&&”does not mean rvalue reference
   ```
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
